issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: YARN-7419 moved Application placement from RMAppManager to RMAppImpl which causes issues since ApplicationSubmissionContext still has the original queue specified by the user and not the mapped queue . This causes issues while doing ACL checks in RMAppManager
fields.summary: Application Placement should be done before ACL checks in ResourceManager

Thanks [~suma.shivaprasad], change looks straightforward to me.

One minor comment: 

{{// fail the submission if configured application timeout value is invalid}} should be moved as well, it is not original purpose of queue mapping logic. 

And is it possible to add an unit test to avoid future regression? 

[~sunilg], could you help to take this forward.
Added UT. Thanks [~wangda]. I did not understand where the logic for application timeout validation needs to be moved ? This was in original code before YARN-7419 changes
I think validateApplicationTimeouts could be placed in RMAppManager itself as it might not be a placement/mapping related to logic ? I think the comment also to be moved down in current patch.
Thanks [~sunilg] Attached patch with comments addressed

Thanks [~sunilg] Attached patch with comments addressed.

RMActiveServiceContext ensures that PlacementManager is not null since is it created during its construction. This is just a safety check to make sure its set. Have added an additional check to log the error and throw an exception if the specified queue is also invalid
